website_summaries.verdict: If you do a lot of movie watching with your PS3, the Sony PlayStation 3 Blu-ray DVD Remote is a nice luxury, but it's not a must-have accessory for the PS3.
pros: For those who plan on regularly using their PS3 for playing Blu-ray and DVD movies, this is an attractively styled Bluetooth remote with a generally well-thought-out button layout and design
The remote also is very responsive and faces no line-of-sight issues because it uses Bluetooth radio, not IR (infrared)
cons: can't control any of your other A/V components
not a huge upgrade over the functionality offered by the PS3's standard controller

customer_reviews.title: Exactly As Described
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly as described, and was needed as a replacement for one which broke. I knew precisely what I was getting so no complaints here... although one would think the price of PS3 Remote Controllers would have come down significantly in price. I am pretty sure I paid right around $20 when I first purchased one with my PS3 four years ago now... If nothing else it should at the very least be cheaper than a new PS4 Remote control (which at the exact same price point it isn't).

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, easy to use and a great alternative to a controller
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mom so she can use my old PS3 for Netflix, Hulu and Blu-Rays. She's pretty technologically illiterate and using the normal controller was frustrating for her. Setting this remote up was super simple (I think even she could have done it if she tried). Since then, my mom has been using it without issue or confusion. I've used it a few times and it's perfect. It's the perfect combination of an easy to use remote and the PS3 controller.

customer_reviews.title: For the Non-gamers in your life...
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, unless you want to hold the hand of anyone in your life who isn't a gamer but wants to watch a movie on your PS3, you need this. It makes watching a DVD or Blu-Ray on the PS3 stress-free for everyone. Setup is easy. For $20, it does the job fine. Also, please note that while some reviews gripe about the incompatibility of Bluetooth technology with most universal remotes, that is a function of the PS3 itself not having an infrared port, not this remote being Bluetooth. It's also why a remote designed to be Bluetooth-only doesn't have controls for everything else in your system, since most other devices use infrared technology.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Remote
customer_reviews.text: I initially had a problem setting up this remote because I was stupid & lost / threw away the instructions. Well, thanks to a guy on Youtube unpacking the unit I was ultimately able to pair it with my playstation. Go to set up menu & set up BD remote under the accessories option. Hit the "start >" (little triangle button next to the select button) and "Enter" button simulaneously (not the "playstation symbol" button - that was my mistake intially) & it will pair in a few seconds. Then it will save the battery on your regular game controller & you are good to go. Good purchase & good price here at Amazon.

customer_reviews.text: The sixaxis controller does everything that you want to do with blu ray / dvd playback but its not convenient at all. Also the Sixaxis is incredibly sensitive and the slightest motion will press one of the buttons causing unexpected results. This blu ray remote from Sony solves all of these and does it with style. It can be used for browsing the PS network store as well, which is an additional bonus. This is a must have for all PS3 owners. Great value for money at this price.

customer_reviews.title: Intuitive remote control for PS3
customer_reviews.text: I'm one of many people who feel that Sony should have included a Bluetooth remote with every PlayStation 3. Remote controls should always come with the items they were meant to control! Having said that, I think this remote does what it's supposed to do with the typical Sony refinement that the company's known for. It looks and feels like the remote that CAME with my Sony XBR LCD television. It's a lot easier than trying to control Blue-Ray/DVD playback with your PS3 controller. Fork over the 20 bucks. You'll be happy you did after getting over your initial bitterness about having to buy something separate that should have been included in your PS3 purchase to begin with!

customer_reviews.title: Good for Netflix and BluRay but Sony TV remote does the same
customer_reviews.text: If you like Netflix and BluRay you will appreciate one of these. Its much easier to use then then the stanadrd ps3 contorller for those tasks. However after I purchaed this remote I discovered that when I hook my PS3 by HDMI to my Sony Bravia TV the TV's remote can control Netflix and BluRay too. And it has volume control unlike the PS3 remote. So if you are using a recently made Sony TV you might want to experiment before deciding to buy this remote too.

It has plenty of buttons, very well organized. It syncs easily to the system, and runs off two AA batteries. I give it 4 starts out of 5 because there's only two minor complaints: the buttons don't light up, and it doesn't charge via usb like the controllers do.
